[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Pontis defines requirements for a bridge management system to streamline inspection, maintenance, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Pontis enables efficient data collection, storage, and analysis for bridge inspection and maintenance.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Pontis integrates with transportation databases, GIS platforms, and inspection tools for structured data management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Pontis provides dashboards for engineers, inspectors, and administrators to visualize and manage bridge data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Pontis operates on desktops and laptops with network connectivity.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Pontis supports SQL-based queries and integrates with GIS tools for spatial analysis.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Pontis ensures secure data transmission using HTTP/HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Pontis efficiently handles large datasets with thousands of bridge records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Pontis supports data updates, inspection scheduling, and maintenance planning.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Pontis is configurable to comply with state-specific regulations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Pontis integrates with maintenance planning systems for scheduling.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Pontis enables bridge condition assessment, lifecycle cost analysis, maintenance planning, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Pontis is designed for engineers, analysts, and inspectors with basic technical proficiency.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Pontis depends on database connectivity, GIS compatibility, and adherence to industry data formats.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Pontis assumes availability of GIS tools, internet access, and supported hardware.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Bridge Element: Components inspected for maintenance.
Lifecycle Cost: Long-term bridge maintenance cost.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall accept bridge inspection data from field tools via APIs.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide dashboards for bridge condition visualization.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall generate maintenance schedules based on bridge condition ratings (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall estimate repair costs using lifecycle cost analysis (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall trigger notifications for overdue inspections.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide configurable dashboards for user tasks (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process 1,000 bridge ratings within 5 seconds (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support concurrent access by 50 users without degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store bridge inspection records for at least 10 years (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall enable retrieval of historical lifecycle cost data (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to open database standards for compatibility.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with AASHTO bridge management guidelines.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain 99.9% uptime and provide user feedback within 2 seconds.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit and integration tests validate scheduling, cost calculations, and GIS integration.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Manuals, GIS integration guides, and maintenance tutorials.
[SEC] 5. References: Pontis Manual, AASHTO Guidelines, GIS Standards.
